title: Superhero Supply Co. - Display Typeface
content:
Does anyone recognize the geometric display typeface used on this packaging? Both for the heading, and "GRAVITY". Looks like a lighter weight of Machine. Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824223743im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gravity_4111.jpg)
author: Chris Keegan

comments.content:
I'm betting on United from House Industries, although the sample I saw online showed an "I" with crossbars.

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=531](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824223743/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=531 "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=531")
Yep. United Sans Semi Condensed Heavy. There’s a serifless, alternate ‘I’, too.
Thanks. I'm pretty sure this was done before United came out, but I could be wrong.
It's not United. The counters in the "R" and "G" aren't angled like United.
